data.value: Downloads Folder

data.name: FoldersSelector_ValidateFolder_DoesNotExist
data.value: Bruh... 🤦... there's not even a folder there.

data.name: FoldersSelector_ValidateUserDataFolder_ModsFolder
data.value: 👏 Very ambitious for taking me right to your Mods folder, but I actually need your User Data Folder (go up one, please!).

data.name: FoldersSelector_ValidateUserDataFolder_NoOptionsIni
data.value: Hey, Silly! That's not your Sims 4 User Data Folder. 😏 Or you need to launch the game once and try again...

data.name: FoldersSelector_ValidateInstallationFolder_NoBinary
data.value: That's not a valid The Sims 4 installation. 🙄

data.name: HUD_GameVersion_Tip_Caption
data.value: Game Version

data.name: HUD_GameVersion_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the current version of The Sims 4 you have installed.

data.name: HUD_Packages_Tip_Caption
data.value: Packages

data.name: HUD_Packages_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the number of packages I was able to catalog in your Mods folder.

data.name: HUD_Packages_Tip_Description_ModsDisabled
data.value: Because Mods are disabled in your Game Options, these packages will not be loaded by The Sims 4.

data.name: HUD_Resources_Tip_Caption
data.value: Resources

data.name: HUD_Resources_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the number of resources in the packages I was able to catalog in your Mods folder.

data.name: HUD_Resources_Tip_Description_CreatorsNote
data.value: Creator's Note: This sum does not account for resource overrides. It is a strict, "dumb sum".

data.name: HUD_Resources_Tip_Description_ModsDisabled
data.value: Because Mods are disabled in your Game Options, these resources will not be loaded by The Sims 4.

data.name: HUD_ScriptArchives_Tip_Caption
data.value: Script Archives

data.name: HUD_ScriptArchives_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the number of script archives I was able to catalog in your Mods folder.

data.name: HUD_ScriptArchives_Tip_ModsDisabled
data.value: Because Script Mods are disabled in your Game Options, these script archives will not be opened and executed by The Sims 4.

data.name: HUD_PythonScripts_Tip_Caption
data.value: Python Scripts

data.name: HUD_PythonScripts_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the number of uncompiled Python scripts I found in script archives in your Mods folder.

data.name: HUD_PythonScripts_Tip_CreatorsNote
data.value: Creator's Note: While The Sims 4 will work with Python scripts, it does so by interpretting them. Maxis' SmartSim engine does not Just-in-Time compile Python scripts in script archives. This means they will underperform considerably. If these are your script archives, strongly consider compiling their scripts to byte code using Python 3.7.

data.name: HUD_ByteCodeFiles_Tip_Caption
data.value: Python Byte Code Files

data.name: HUD_ByteCodeFiles_Tip_Description
data.value: This is the number of compiled Python byte code files I found in script archives in your Mods folder.

data.name: HUD_ByteCodeFiles_Tip_ModsDisabled
data.value: Because Script Mods are disabled in your Game Options, these compiled Python byte code files will not be loaded and executed by The Sims 4.

data.name: HUD_ComposingManifests_Tip_Caption
data.value: Composing Manifests

data.name: HUD_ComposingManifests_Tip_Description
data.value: It's probably best that I do not actively read your Mods folder while I'm also... writing to it? I'll resume cataloging as soon as these manifests are written. 😏

data.name: HUD_Sleeping_Tip_Caption
data.value: Sleeping

data.name: HUD_Sleeping_Tip_Description
data.value: It's probably best that I do not actively read your Mods folder while you're playing to maximize your computer's resources for the game itself. I'll wake up as soon as you exit the game. 😏

data.name: HUD_Waiting_Tip_Caption
data.value: Waiting

data.name: HUD_Waiting_Tip_Description
data.value: I'm just waiting for activity in your Mods folder to die down and then I'll have a look. 😏

data.name: HUD_CatalogingMods_Tip_Caption
data.value: Cataloging Mods

data.name: HUD_CatalogingMods_Tip_Description
data.value: I'm currently combing through the files in your Mods folder and scribbling down notes, don't mind me. 😏

data.name: HUD_CatalogingETA_Tip_Caption
data.value: Cataloging ETA

data.name: HUD_CatalogingETA_Tip_Estimating
data.value: Estimating

data.name: HUD_CatalogingETA_Tip_Description
data.value: This is my best guess as to how much longer this process is going to take. It will fluctuate a bit as I progress, but less so as I near the end of the list of files.

data.name: HUD_AnalyzingTopography_Tip_Caption
data.value: Analyzing Topography

data.name: HUD_AnalyzingTopography_Tip_Description
data.value: I'm taking a closer look at your package load order and reviewing how your mods are interacting with each other to see if I need to warn you about anything. 😏

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_Heading_1
data.value: Teach me about your mod so I can help players (and other creators) with it.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_Heading_2
data.value: It will be manifestly awesome. 😏

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_Guidance
data.value:
Let's start by selecting any file for your mod.

It doesn’t matter if it’s a package or a script archive. If there's more than one file for your mod, you can just pick the most prominent one, the first one you made, the one that’s first alphabetically, or pick one at random. Doesn’t really matter 🤷. You'll be able to specify any remaining files later in this process.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_CheckForScaffoldingLocation_Label
data.value: Check for scaffolding in a "PlumbBuddy" subfolder first.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_Picker_Label
data.value: Any File from Your Mod

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_CheckForScaffoldingLocation_Tip
data.value: I'll check in both places either way, but you can use this switch to control where I look first.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_BatchUpdate_Label
data.value: Update all the Manifests in Mods in a Folder

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_BatchUpdate_Tip
data.value: Click this button to select a folder and then update the manifests in every mod found in a recursive search of the folder. Any problems or warnings encountered by the Manifest Editor will immediately interrupt the process.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_Heading_1
data.value: Alright, let's get started nice and easy... 😅

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_Heading_2
data.value: 📝 How about we cover the basics first?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_ModName_HelperText
data.value: What's your mod called? Pretty simple.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_Creators_Placeholder
data.value: Enter a creator name here and press enter

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_Creators_HelperText
data.value: So uhh... 🕵️‍♂️ who's responsible for this?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_DownloadPageUrl_Label
data.value: Download Page URL

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_DownloadPageUrl_HelperText
data.value: This should be a web page on which links or buttons are available to download the mod files for THIS MOD.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_OpenInWebBrowser_Tip
data.value: Open in Web Browser

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_SeeThingsNotToDo_Tip
data.value: See Things Not To Do

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_SeeThingsNotToDo_Popover_1
ManifestEditor_Details_SeeThingsNotToDo_Popover_2
data.value: If you are concerned about the stability of the URL you currently have for any reason, consider [applying for a modding community sponsored redirect URL](https://plumbbuddy.app/community-services/redirect-hosting) which you will be able to change later to suit your needs.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_SeeThingsToDo_Popover
ManifestEditor_Details_SeeThingsToDo_Tip
data.value: See Things To Do

data.name: ManifestEditor_Details_Label
data.value: Details

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_Label
data.value: Select

data.name: ManifestEditor_Components_Label
data.value: Components

data.name: ManifestEditor_Components_Heading_1
data.value: Here are all the files we currently consider a part of your mod.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Components_Heading_2
data.value: 🏗️ Are we leaving anything out?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Components_DuplicateSettings_Tip_Caption
data.value: Duplicate Settings

data.name: ManifestEditor_Components_DuplicateSettings_Tip_Description
data.value: Duplicate these settings, applying them to multiple mod files at once.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_Label
data.value: Requirements

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_Heading_1
data.value: 🤔 We're all searching for fulfillment at the end of the day.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_Heading_2
data.value: What does your mod need to be happy? 😊

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_RequiredPacks_Label
data.value: Required Packs

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_RequiredPacks_HelperText
data.value: Does your mod need any official The Sims 4 packs from Electronic Arts to work?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_RequiredPacks_Selector_Placeholder
data.value: (click here to select/search for packs)

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_RequiredPacks_Freeform_Placeholder
data.value: Type a pack code like GP08 for Realm of Magic and press enter

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_PromoCode_HelperText
data.value: If you have been invited to the EA Creator Network, PlumbBuddy can give players your Promo Code to use at check-out when buying packs to use with your mod.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_PromoCode_Label
data.value: EA Promo Code

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_IncompatiblePacks_Label
data.value: Incompatible Packs

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_IncompatiblePacks_HelperText
data.value: Are there any official The Sims 4 packs from Electronic Arts that will cause your mod to NOT WORK?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_IncompatiblePacks_Selector_Placeholder
data.value: (click here to select/search for packs)

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_IncompatiblePacks_Freeform_Placeholder
data.value: Type a pack code like GP12 for Werewolves and press enter

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_AddRequiredMod_Label
data.value: Add Required Mod...

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_AddRequiredMod_Popover
data.value:
If *your whole mod* will only work with the presence of other mods, even under certain conditions, let me know about it here.
If only *parts* of your mod need to be present or not based on whether packs or other mods are present or not, the step to tell me about that was **Components**. But don't worry! You can always go back!

data.name: ManifestEditor_Requirements_RemoveRequirement_Label
data.value: Remove Requirement

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Label
data.value: Cross-Mod

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Heading_1
data.value: 🕹️ Entertaining the player ourselves isn't the only way we can bring value.

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Heading_2
data.value: Sometimes it's helping others shine. 💁‍♀️

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Version_Label
data.value: Version

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_VersionToggle_Label
data.value: I maintain versions of my mod.

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_SemanticVersioning_Label
data.value: Quick Semantic Versioning Links

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_SemanticVersioning_MajorLink
data.value: I made changes to my mod which will break other mods that require it.

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_SemanticVersioning_MinorLink
data.value: I added features to my mod in a way which will not break other mods that require it.

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_SemanticVersioning_PatchLink
data.value: I made other changes to my mod in a way which will not break other mods that require it.

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Features_Label
data.value: Features

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Features_Placeholder
data.value: Type a feature name here and press enter

data.name: ManifestEditor_CrossMod_Features_HelperText
data.value: You can use this field to establish feature flags. When other creators reference your mod as a requirement, they will be able to specify which features they need. This can be seen as an alternative to version ranges.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Label
data.value: Hashing

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Heading_1
data.value: Some players like to alter packages for their own purposes. 📦

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Heading_2
data.value: 🔐 We should talk about what you're comfortable with.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Info
data.value: I identify your mod's files on players' computers by examining the contents of the files, *not* by trusting file names. This is because players can (and do) rename mod files to influence the game's mod load order. I need to know what things in your mod's files to consider in identifying your mod.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Warning
data.value: The inclination to increase this setting because the thought of players altering your mods upsets you is valid. But please do consider that some players may be using your mod in a language for which you do not provide a translation, for example, and arbitrary strictness here will punish them when that may not be your intention.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_Label
data.value: Hashing Elements

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_OtherPackageData
data.value: Other Package Data

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_Tuning
data.value: Tuning

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_SimData
data.value: Sim Data

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_Images
data.value: Images

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_HashingElements_StringTables
data.value: String Tables

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Label
data.value: Confirm

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_ErrorHeading_1
data.value: 🛑 Woah, there, Chief! We can't quite do this... ⛔

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_ErrorHeading_2
data.value: 👈 It looks like you need to go back and fix something.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_ReadyHeading_2
data.value:
Click
FINISH
to update the manifest in your {0} and they'll be ready to go. 🚀

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_ReadyHeading_2_ModFile
data.value: mod file
data.comment: This noun will be pluralized by Humanizer.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_ReadyHeading_1
data.value: 📃 If I had any notes or concerns, I put them below. If the area's blank then... 🤷 no notes.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_WriteScaffoldingLocation_Label
data.value: Write scaffolding in a "PlumbBuddy" subfolder to keep my mod files' folder more orderly.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Select_WriteScaffoldingLocation_Tip
data.value: I'll clean up any old, unneeded scaffolding files left behind if you change this setting.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Heading_1
data.value: ☝️ Please wait just a moment.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Heading_2
data.value: 🚧 Manifest Composition is in progress. 🚧

data.name: ManifestEditor_UsePublicPackCatalog_Label
data.value: Use PlumbBuddy.app Public Pack Catalog when entering Pack Codes

data.name: ManifestEditor_UsePublicPackCatalog_Tip
data.value: Switching this on will cause fields which expect Pack Codes to connect to the PlumbBuddy.app web site, allowing you to search and select from its Public Pack Catalog instead of having to know the codes yourself. This feature requires an Internet connection.

data.name: ManifestEditor_BatchUpdate_Status
data.value: Processing {0} (mod file {1:n0} of {2:n0})
data.comment: {0} = Name of current mod file; {1} = Number of current mod file in sequence; {2} Total number of mod files in sequence

data.value: Stop

data.value: Cancel

data.value: Completed

data.value: Finish

data.value: Next

data.name: Common_Optional
data.value: Optional

data.name: Common_Previous
data.value: Previous

data.name: Common_Skip
data.value: Skip

data.name: Common_Skipped
data.value: Skipped

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Slider_TickMark_1
data.value: Lenient

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Slider_TickMark_2
data.value: Moderate (Recommended)

data.name: ManifestEditor_Hashing_Slider_TickMark_3
data.value: Strict

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_InaccessiblePackage_Caption
data.value: Package corrupt, damaged, or locked

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_InaccessiblePackage_Text
data.value:
I was unable to read this file as a valid Maxis DataBase Packed File with exclusive access: `{1}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to Mod File

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_SelectedMergedPackage_Caption
data.value: Package is the result of multiple manifested packages which were merged

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_SelectedMergedPackage_Text
data.value:
Just so you're aware... this file has multiple manifests. Frankly, not the best. Don't worry, I'll tidy things up and leave it with just one when we finish here. `{0}`

From the available **Manifest Snippet Tuning Resource Names**, I selected `{1}`. You can change that if you want by selecting this file on the **Components** step.

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to Mod File; {1} = Selected manifest resource name

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_InaccessibleScriptArchive_Caption
data.value: Script archive corrupt, damaged, or locked

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_InaccessibleScriptArchive_Text
data.value:
I was unable to read this file as a valid ZIP archive with exclusive access: `{0}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to Mod File

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_UnrecognizedFileType_Caption
data.value: new extension... who dis?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_UnrecognizedFileType_Text
data.value:
What even is this? `{0}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to Mod File

data.value: Computing manifest hash for `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_InitializingManifest
data.value: Initializing manfiest for `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_GeneratingCrossReferenceRequirements
data.value: Generating cross-reference requirements for `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_AddingCrossReferenceRequirements
data.value: Adding cross-reference requirements to `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_SavingManifest
data.value: Saving manifest to `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_CreatingScaffolding
data.value: Creating scaffolding for `{0}`

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_ManifestCompositionFailure_Caption
data.value: Something went wrong

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_ManifestCompositionFailure_Text
data.value: While I was writing your manifests, an unexpected error occurred. I've written it to my log file.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Composing_Status_Finished
data.value: All component manifests have been updated and scaffolding has been written

data.name: ManifestEditor_Loading_ReadingModFiles
data.value: Reading mod files

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_DuplicateComponentSettings_Caption
data.value: This Cannot Be Undone

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_DuplicateComponentSettings_Text
data.value: I am about to apply the component settings on screen now to every mod file you have checked in the list.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_SelectAModFileFirst_Caption
data.value: Select a mod file first

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_SelectAModFileFirst_Text
data.value: A journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step. And this is gonna be like... *much quicker* than that.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Loading_ExaminingModFile
data.value: Examining mod file

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_ScaffoldingReferenceBroken_Caption
data.value: Scaffolding points to missing file

data.name: ManifestEditor_Error_ScaffoldingReferenceBroken_Text
data.value:
When you last updated the manifest in this mod, it had a file at this location which I failed to find. If you weren't expecting to see this message, you should probably investigate. `{0}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Absolute path to Mod File

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_MissingScaffolding_Caption
data.value: So, a manifest but no scaffolding, eh?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_MissingScaffolding_Text
data.value:
There are only a few reasons this might happen. In any case, you are seen. 1. *You are* the original creator of this mod and you don't back up your files (in which case, for shame). You're going to have to re-add all of your mod's components without the scaffolding, but I will clean-up intramod requirements for you automatically as you go. 2. You're a kind soul adopting an orphaned mod and the marmot smiles down upon you. If so, we do have [some potentially useful advice for you](https://plumbbuddy.app/community-services/adoption-guidance). 3. You're *one of those* players who knows just enough to be dangerous, you lied to me during Onboarding, and now you're about to *do something **really stupid***. [Enjoy breaking things](https://youtu.be/m_F8wSZT3QY), I guess. 🤷

via GIPHY

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_ConfirmWithWarnings_Caption
data.value: Point of No Return

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_ConfirmWithWarnings_Text
data.value: You *still* have **unresolved warnings** regarding your mod's manifest. I *can* proceed with these issues if you think I'm mistaken, but *you are responsible for ignoring these warnings if I'm not*.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_RemoveModFiles_Caption
data.value: This Cannot Be Undone

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_RemoveModFiles_Text
data.value: If I remove the selected components of your mod and you change your mind, you'll need to click cancel on the bottom of the window and start the whole process over again or add them back manually.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_RemoveRequiredMod_Caption
data.value: Are you sure?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_RemoveRequiredMod_Text
data.value:
You're about to remove your mod's requirement of {0}. If you change your mind you'll have to **Cancel** and start from scratch or add it back.

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Required Mod Name

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_RemoveRequiredMod_Text_ModNameFallback
data.value: this mod

data.value: The following files had manifests that *needed* to be updated: {0}

data.name: ManifestEditor_BatchUpdate_Report_ManifestsNotUpdated
data.value: The following files had manifests that *did not need* to be updated: {0}
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = List of Mod Files

data.name: ManifestEditor_BatchUpdate_Report_ModFilesNotScaffolded
data.value: The following files had no scaffolding and were therefore skipped: {0}
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = List of Mod Files

data.name: ManifestEditor_Question_CopyBatchUpdateReportToClipboard_Caption
data.value: Would you like to copy this Batch Processing Report to your computer's clipboard?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Success_BatchUpdateReportCopiedToClipboard_Caption
data.value: Report Successfully Copied to Clipboard

data.name: ManifestEditor_Success_BatchUpdateReportCopiedToClipboard_Text
data.value: Paste it where you like. 😏

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_BatchUpdateNoModFilesManifested_Caption
data.value: Whole Lotta Noth'n

data.name: ManifestEditor_Info_BatchUpdateNoModFilesManifested_Text
data.value: None of the mod files examined had manifests to potentially be updated.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_OfferToCancel_Caption
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel?

data.name: ManifestEditor_Caution_OfferToCancel_Text
data.value: I'll discard any changes you've made to this manifest and go back to the beginning of the process.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Error_NonUniqueManifestSnippetTuningNames
data.value: Whoops, it looks like you used the `{0}` **Manifest Snippet Tuning Resource Name** for each of the following mod files when they each need to be unique. You can go back to the **Components** step to fix this. {1}
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Manifest Snippet Tuning Name; {1} = List of Mod Files

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_BlankManifestSnippetTuningName
data.value: Your `{0}` mod file is a package with a **Manifest Snippet Tuning Resource Name** which you left either blank or just as white space. Since I have to have something substantive and unique there, if we continue I'm going to generate something for you. If you'd rather I didn't, you can go back to the **Components** step and fill it in for yourself.
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Mod File

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_BlankModName
data.value: *Your mod has no name!* You can go back to the **Details** step and type one in, and probably should because if you don't: * If a problem comes up and I need to discuss your mod with a player it will be awkward because I'll have to refer to file names when I could be using a more familiar name. * If your mod is ever referenced as a dependency and then a player doesn't have it, that conversation gets even more awkward because I have to discuss them getting it without telling them what it's called.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_NoCreators
data.value: *You haven't specified any creators.* Look, I know stepping into the limelight can be a bit daunting... but you deserve recognition for what you've done! You can go back to the **Details** step and fill in your own name and the names of anyone who worked with you on this mod.

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_BlankDownloadPageUrl
data.value: *Your mod does not have a valid download page URL!* You can go back to the **Details** step and type one in, and probably should because if you don't: * If a problem comes up and I need to discuss your mod with a player it will be awkward because I'll have no place to send them on the web if they need to download a fresh copy or an update. * If your mod is ever referenced as a dependency and then a player doesn't have it or needs to update it, that conversation gets even more awkward because... again... what do I say? Google it? Come on, don't do that to me... 😔

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_BlankRequiredModName
data.value: *Your **{0}** required mod has no name!* You can go back to the **Requirements** step and type one in, and probably should because if you don't and a problem comes up and I need to discuss your mod's requirements with a player, it's gonna be very vague. *Did you notice how I just had to tell you which requirement has this problem **with a number?***
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Requirement Ordinal (e.g. first, second, thirteenth, etc.)

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Warning_BlankRequiredModDownloadPageUrl
data.value: *Your **{0}** required mod doesn't have a valid download page URL!* You can go back to the **Requirements** step and type one in, and probably should because if you don't and a problem comes up and I need to discuss your mod's requirement with a player, it will be awkward because the only place to send them on the web to try to find a fresh copy of the requirement will be your mod's download page. Not the best user experience.
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Required Mod Name

data.name: ManifestEditor_Confirm_Note_BlankPromoCode
data.value:
Your mod requires packs which some players may not have, but might purchase specifically to use with *your mod*, and yet, you have not given me an **EA Promo Code**. If you do have one, you really shouldn't be leaving money on the table like this, friend. Consider doing yourself a solid, heading back to the **Requirements** step, and filling in that code.
If you don't have one, but you're interested in getting a commission for all the packs your awesome mod is about to help EA sell, please allow me to [direct you to where that journey begins](https://creatornetwork.ea.com/).

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IsRequired_Label
data.value: My mod requires this file to work properly — it is not an optional add-on to suit the player's preferences.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_RequirementIdentifier_Label
data.value: Requirement Identifier

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_RequirementIdentifier_HelperText
data.value: If set, the player must have at least one file using this requirement identifier. Requirement Identifiers are scoped only to your mod. You don't need to worry about making them globally unique.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_RequirementIdentifier_Placeholder
data.value: (currently independently required)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackAvailable_Label
data.value: Ignore if Pack Available

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackAvailable_HelperText
data.value: Instructs agents to ignore this requirement if an official The Sims 4 pack from Electronic Arts has been installed by the player.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackAvailable_Selector_Placeholder
data.value: (click here to select/search for a pack)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackAvailable_Freeform_Placeholder
data.value: (use a pack code like EP01 for Get to Work)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackUnavailable_Label
data.value: Ignore if Pack Unavailable

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackUnavailable_HelperText
data.value: Instructs agents to ignore this requirement if an official The Sims 4 pack from Electronic Arts has not been installed by the player.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackUnavailable_Freeform_Placeholder
data.value: (use a pack code like SP46 for Home Chef Hustle)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfPackUnavailable_Selector_Placeholder
data.value: (click here to select/search for a pack)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashAvailable_Label
data.value: Ignore if Hash Available

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashAvailable_HelperText
data.value: Instructs agents to ignore this requirement if the presence of a mod manifest hash in the load order indicates the player has installed another mod.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashAvailable_Placeholder
data.value: (hash of the mod's manifest in hex format)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashUnavailable_Label
data.value: Ignore if Hash Unavailable

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashUnavailable_HelperText
data.value: Instructs agents to ignore this requirement if the absence of a mod manifest hash in the load order indicates the player has not installed another mod.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_IgnoreIfHashUnavailable_Placeholder
data.value: (hash of the mod's manifest in hex format)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_Exclusivities_Label
data.value: Exclusivities

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_Exclusivities_HelperText
data.value: Only one file with the same exclusivity will be permitted. If PlumbBuddy discovers multiple manifests in the same Mods folder with the same exclusivity, this will generate a warning for the player. Use this to mark mod files that are incompatible with each other, such as when they needed to select one package or another depending on whether they have a pack or another mod installed.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_Exclusivities_Placeholder
data.value: Type the name of an exclusivity here and press enter

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_Exclusivities_Guidance
data.value: **Exclusivity** is globally scoped in the mod load order. Make sure to include elements uniquely identifying your mod if other mods should not be considered. For example: > vyxated - Chalk'd UI - Support - TMEX - Smarter Pie Menu

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_ComponentName_Label
data.value: Component Name

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_ComponentName_HelperText
data.value: Since each file in your mod will have its own manifest resource, it can technically have a different name if you want it to. This can be good for specifically labeling add-ons. It would probably be smart, however, to still include the full name of your mod, e.g. Vacuum Clean the Cats: Discover University Support.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_ComponentName_Placeholder
data.value: (type a specific name for this component if you want)

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_ManifestSnippetTuningResourceName_Label
data.value: Manifest Snippet Tuning Resource Name

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_ManifestSnippetTuningResourceName_HelperText
data.value: Because this component of your mod is a package file, its manifest will be will be a snippet tuning resource in your package. This is the name of that resource and it should be unique. I will generate the full instance for the snippet tuning resource on my own using the Sims 4 modding community standard implementation of the 64-bit Fowler–Noll–Vo hash function with the highest-order bit set.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_SubsumedHashes_Label
data.value: Subsumed Hashes

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_SubsumedHashes_HelperText
data.value: These are the hashes of previous version of this mod file. The manifest keeps them so that if I'm checking to see if a player has your mod installed because another mod requires it, the other mod requiring an older version of your mod is not a problem. However, if you make breaking changes in this mod file you should probably clear these out so that it will be obvious that your newer version isn't going to work well with the other mod. Otherwise, it's best to leave this field alone and let me manage it for you.

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_SubsumedHashes_Placeholder
data.value: Enter a hex-formatted SHA 256 manifest hash here and press enter

data.name: ManifestComponentEditor_AddSubsumedHashFromModFile_Local
data.value: Add subsumed hash from mod file...

data.name: ModFileSelector_SelectAModFile_Caption
data.value: Select a Mod File

data.name: ModFileSelector_SelectAModFileManifest_Error_NoManifests_Caption
data.value: Mod file contains no manifests

data.name: ModFileSelector_SelectAModFileManifest_Error_NoManifests_Text
data.value:
I'm sorry, but the mod file you selected doesn't contain any manifests. For technical reasons, it simply isn't safe to try to reference it in this manner. All you can do for now is *politely* ask the original creator to publish it with a manifest in their next release... and then wait **patiently**. `{0}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to the Mod File

data.name: ModFileSelector_SelectAModFileManifest_Info_MultipleManifests_Caption
data.value: Mod file contains multiple manifests

data.name: ModFileSelector_SelectAModFileManifest_Info_MultipleManifests_Text
data.value:
This is embarassing, but I'm going to have to ask you to select precisely which of the manifests this mod file contains that you mean because some bozo merged their files and didn't update the manifests. 🤦 `{0}`

via GIPHY
data.comment: This text is in Markdown. {0} = Full path to the Mod File

data.name: ModFileSelector_Validate_FileNotFound
data.value: There is no file at this location.

data.name: ModFileSelector_Validate_InvalidFormat
data.value: This is not a Maxis DBPF package or a TS4 script archive.

data.name: ModRequirementEditor_Name_HelperText
data.value: If a player installs your mod but does not have this requirement, this is the name I will use to describe the missing requirement to them.

data.name: ModRequirementEditor_Creators_HelperText
data.value: If a player installs your mod but does not have this requirement, these are the creators I may tell them about when describing the missing requirement to them.

data.name: ModRequirementEditor_RequiredFeatures_Label
data.value: Required Features

data.name: ModRequirementEditor_RequiredFeatures_HelperText
data.value: These are the features the required mod must offer in order for your requirement to be satisfied. This field exists just in case the required mod's creator ever removes a feature, I can guide the player through resolving the issue.

data.name: ModRequirementEditor_SelectFeaturesBasedOnModFileManifest_Label
data.value: Select features based on a mod file manifest...

data.name: ScanIssuesDisplay_MDCAsleep_Description
data.value: Since we shouldn't be doing anything to your Mods folder while the game is running, I hope you won't mind if I catch a few winks while you play.

data.name: ScanIssuesDisplay_MDCAsleep_Caption
data.value: Game's Running... So Sleepy...

data.name: ScanIssuesDisplay_MDCRefreshing_Caption
data.value: I'm Looking at Your Mods Folder...

data.name: ScanIssuesDisplay_MDCRefreshing_Description
data.value: Once I'm done I'll let you know if there's anything to be concerned about. Don't worry, anything important will be at the top of the list!

data.name: ScanIssuesDisplay_MDCRefreshing_Warning
data.value: Please don't launch the game right now!
